messages.title: Jo Swinson's Plan for Britain's Future
messages.content: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give Every Child the Best Start in Life
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Recruit 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.
Provide free childcare from 9 months and give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills and training throughout their lives.
Treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

endorsements.endorsement: I've worked in the green industry for 20 years now and it's clear to me the Liberal Democrats have the best plan to tackle the climate emergency.

endorsements.endorser: Gabriel Rozenberg, former Conservative councillor in Barnet
endorsements.endorsement: The Conservatives have become a party promoting an extremist view of isolationism. It wasn't an easy decision to make but I could no longer campaign for them.
I'm backing the Liberal Democrats because they've led the fight for mental health provision in the NHS.
I firmly believe that Britain is better off in the EU. As a result I have now found a new home within the Liberal Democrats.

Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.
Recruit 20,000 more teachers as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.

personalStories.story: I've worked in the green industry for 20 years now and it's clear to me the Liberal Democrats have the best plan to tackle the climate emergency. We can't afford to wait any longer and I trust Jo Swinson's Liberal Democrats to bring about the change we all so desperately need.

I'm backing the Liberal Democrats because they've led the fight for mental health provision in the NHS. As a psychiatrist, I see that the mental health is put at the bottom of the pile, behind other illnesses - that has to stop. The Liberal Democrats will put an extra £11 billion into mental health services ensuring that mental health is treated with the same urgency as physical health.

I firmly believe that Britain is better off in the EU. As a result I have now found a new home within the Liberal Democrats. I am proud to join the progressive party. I left Labour as a direct consequence of the direction in which the party is moving.

examples: Gabriel Rozenberg, former Conservative councillor in Barnet
The Conservatives have become a party promoting an extremist view of isolationism. It wasn't an easy decision to make but I could no longer campaign for them.
